metadata.title: Journal Pre-proof Development of Reverse Transcription Loop-mediated Isothermal Amplification (RT- LAMP) Assays Targeting SARS-CoV-2 Development of Reverse Transcription Loop-mediated Isothermal Amplification (RT-LAMP) Assays Targeting SARS-CoV-2 3 4

abstract.original_text: Epidemics of Coronavirus Disease 2019 now have more than 100,000 confirmed 34 cases worldwide. Diagnosis of COVID-19 is currently performed by RT-qPCR methods, but the 35 capacity of RT-qPCR methods is limited by its requirement of high-level facilities and instruments.

sentences.segment_text: Epidemics of Coronavirus Disease 2019 now have more than 100,000 confirmed 34 cases worldwide .
Diagnosis of COVID-19 is currently performed by RT-qPCR methods ,
but the 35 capacity of RT-qPCR methods is limited by its requirement of high-level facilities and instruments .

abstract.original_text: Here, we developed and evaluated RT-LAMP assays to detect genomic RNA of SARS-CoV-2, the 37 causative virus of COVID-19. RT-LAMP assays in this study can detect as low as 100 copies of 38 SARS-CoV-2 RNA. Cross-reactivity of RT-LAMP assays to other human Coronaviruses was not 39 observed. We also adapted a colorimetric detection method for our RT-LAMP assay so that the tests 40 potentially performed in higher throughput.

sentences.segment_text: Here , we developed and evaluated RT-LAMP assays to detect genomic RNA of SARS-CoV-2 ,
RT-LAMP assays in this study can detect as low as 100 copies of 38 SARS-CoV-2 RNA .
Cross-reactivity of RT-LAMP assays to other human Coronaviruses was not 39 observed .
We also adapted a colorimetric detection method for our RT-LAMP assay so that the tests 40 potentially performed in higher throughput .
